article.Heading: RBI to work with PSU banks to tackle bad loans: Sources
article.Summary: Quoting sources, Alexander Mathew of CNBC-TV18 reports that the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is working alongside banks to formulate a new method to deal with bad loans, which may involve sale of distressed assets under a closed auction.
article.Body:
As on end December 2015, listed public sector banks were sitting on close to Rs 4 lakh crore (Rs 4 trillion) of bad loans. Some of it has been recognised and provisions made, but the problem is far from over. 

As a result, state-owned banks are looking forward to a generous infusion of capital from its biggest shareholder, the government of India, in the upcoming Budget.

Quoting sources, Alexander Mathew of CNBC-TV18 reports that the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is working alongside banks to formulate a new method to deal with bad loans, which may involve sale of distressed assets under a closed auction.

Watch video for more.
